content:
• Wednesday, December 13, 2017
  • IMUC

    ImmunoCellular Therapeutics +158% on immuno-oncology milestone

    • ImmunoCellular Therapeutics (OTCPK:IMUC) +158% after-hours on news it achieved a key milestone in its research-stage Stem-to-T-Cell immuno-oncology program.
    • IMUC says the milestone represents an important step toward stimulating the patient's immune system to produce an unlimited supply of killer T cells that specifically target and destroy tumor cells with minimal side effects, which could prove effective in treating many types of cancers.
    • IMUC says its stem cell technology has the potential for meaningful advantages over other novel immuno-oncology technologies, including use in combination approaches, and it is exploring potential collaborations for its clinical programs and other strategic alternatives.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 PM | 14 Comments
  • ARGX

    Argenx raises $231M in upsized public offering

    • Argenx (NASDAQ:ARGX) has raised about $231M after upsizing a public offering today.
    • The company sold 4.44M ADS, up from a total it raised to 3.5M earlier, at $52 each.
    • Underwriters still have a 30-day option to buy up to 15% more (666,000 ADS) at the offering price.
    • Shares declined 4.1% on Nasdaq today to close at $52.73.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:33 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: BAND +11.2%. NDSN +9.5%. GLUU +5.8%. LITE +3.2%. BSBR +2.2%.
    • Top losers: PIR -22.6%. ABM -9.9%. TNTR-OLD -5.6%. VCO-OLD -4.3%. TECK -2.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 10 Comments
  • FOX

    WSJ: Disney/Fox deal would value Fox as a whole over $40/share

    • The deal now expected to arrive tomorrow that hands many of the entertainment assets of Twenty-First Century Fox (FOX, FOXA) to Walt Disney (NYSE:DIS) is coming at a price that values Fox as a whole at just over $40/share.
    • Disney's not taking all of Fox -- Fox would retain its news operations, Fox Sports 1 and its broadcast network -- but it would be paying about $29/share to Fox for the media assets it wants.
    • That news has FOXA on the move after hours: up 1.4% to $33.20. FOX is up 2.8% to $33.25. Disney is flat in postmarket trading so far.
    • The deal's expected to be all stock, with Disney assuming some Fox debt in the process.
    • Previously: CNBC: Disney-Fox asset deal seen at $60B (Dec. 13 2017)
    • Previously: CNBC: Disney on 'glide path' for Thursday Fox asset deal (Dec. 12 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM | 34 Comments
  • PBYI

    EMA's oncology advisory group to render opinion on Puma Bio's neratinib next month; shares slip 2% after hours

    • Puma Biotechnology (NYSE:PBYI) eases 2% after hours on light volume in response to its announcement that the European Medicines Agency (EMA) has asked the Scientific Advisory Group on Oncology to provide an opinion on the clinical data supporting the company's marketing application seeking approval for neratinib for the extended adjuvant treatment of early-stage HER2-positive breast cancer in patients previously treated with a regimen containing Roche's Herceptin (trastuzumab). The group will meet on January 11, 2018.
    • The EMA accepted the application for review on August 22. The company says it will respond to the Day-180 List of Outstanding Issues by December 22.
    • The normal EMA review period is 210 days so an opinion by the Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use (CHMP) should be issued on or about March 20, 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • TNTR-OLD

    Tintri -9% on weak Q3, downside guidance, and strategic option talks

    • Tintri (NASDAQ:TNTR-OLD) shares are down 9% aftermarket following Q3 results that met EPS estimates but missed on revenue. Downside Q4 guidance has revenue from $25M to $27M (consensus: $42.89M) and EPS from -$0.83 to -$0.79 (consensus: $-0.68).
    • CEO Ken Klein expresses disappointment with Q3 revenue and says the company was impacted by delayed and reduced purchases but some of those delayed transactions closed last month. 
    • Klein: “We are exploring strategic options available to the company to deliver value to our stockholders, including retaining investment bank advisors to assist us in this process and optimizing our operating model to reduce our cash burn rate and shorten the time to generate positive cash flow.” 
    • Press release       
    • Previously: Tintri EPS in-line, misses on revenue (Dec. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 4 Comments
  • BAND

    Bandwidth +10.2% as first public report shows revenue growth

    • Bandwidth (NASDAQ:BAND) is up 10.2% after hours following its release of Q3 earnings, its first report since starting trading Nov. 10.
    • Revenues grew steadily and gross profit ticked up to $19.9M (non-GAAP basis) from a year-ago $18.3M. Gross margin rose to 48% from 47%.
    • Net income dipped slightly, to $2.2M (non-GAAP) from a year-ago $3.7M. EBITDA of $5.2M beat an expected $4.2M.
    • Active CPaaS customers were 918, up 18% Y/Y as of Sept. 30. Dollar-based net retention rate was 105% vs. a year-ago 112% mainly due to a "decision to curtail services to a competitor."
    • Cash and equivalents were $5.4M, with $38.5M in debt as of Sept. 30; the Nov. 14 IPO generated $74.4M, some of which was used to pay the outstanding term loan facility.
    • For Q4, it's guiding to total revenue of $41.4M-$41.9M (vs. $41.5M consensus), with CPaaS revenue coming in at $34.2M-$34.7M. It sees non-GAAP EPS of $0.00-$0.01, above consensus for -$0.02.
    • For the full year, total revenues are forecast at $161.9M-$162.4M, above consensus for $161.5M. EPS is forecast at $0.50-$0.51, vs. consensus for $0.66.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • PIR

    Soft guidance crushes Pier 1 Imports

    • Pier 1 Imports (NYSE:PIR) reports comparable sales fell 0.7% in FQ3. The company says the hurricanes in Florida and Texas impacted comparable sales by about 100 bps.
    • E-commerce penetration rose six full percentage points to 26% of sales during the quarter.
    • The higher mix of e-commerce sales contributed to a drop in gross profit rate to 37.7% of sales vs. 41.3% a year ago. Merchandise margin fell to 57.3% of sales vs. 60.2% a year ago.
    • Pier 1 ended the quarter with an inventory position of $419M, down 13% Y/Y.
    • Q4 guidance: Comparable sales growth -3.5% to -1.5%, total sales growth +1% to +3%, EPS $0.16 to $0.24 vs. $0.38 consensus.
    • Full-year guidance: Comparable sales growth -1% to flat, total sales growth is expected to be flat, EPS $0.17 to $0.25.
    • Shares of Pier 1 are down 21% AH to $4.60.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 18 Comments
  • SYNA

    Synaptics +5.6% after "upbeat" analyst day, analyst comments

    • Synaptics (NASDAQ:SYNA) shares are up 5.6% after yesterday’s analyst day was “upbeat.”
    • Mizuho says Synaptics was optimistic about its acquisitions and IoT opportunities during the event. The company mentioned successes in its in-display fingerprint sensor.
    • Mizuho rates Synaptics at Neutral with a  $42 price target.
    • Cowen raises its price target from $53 to $58 as Synaptics’ mid-term target has operating margins above the firm’s expectations. 
    • Cowen calls Synaptics “significantly undervalued” and expects multiple OEM launches next year with higher ASPs than past products. 
    • Stifel notes that the company’s total addressable market is now over $10.6B, up from $7.9B before the recent acquisitions. 
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word     
    • Previously: Synaptics enters mass production for in-display fingerprint sensor (Dec. 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • AMAT

    Stifel names top wafer fab equipment buys

    • Stifel expects wafer fab equipment spending to finish near $44B for 2017 and project 5% growth to $46B next year.
    • The firm thinks the WFE industry has become more secular, dimming the relevance of cyclical trends. 
    • Stifel’s top WFE picks (with rating and price target): Applied Materials (AMAT +0.9%), Buy and $50.47; MKS Instruments (MKSI +0.9%), Buy and $93.15; Entegris (ENTG -0.2%), Buy and $29.55; FormFactor (FORM +0.3%), Buy and $14.85; Ichor Holdings (ICHR +0.7%), Buy and $23.64.       
    • Previously: Western Digital and Toshiba announce agreement on chip unit, Fab 6 (Dec. 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 18 Comments
  • CMCSA

    TiVo drops again on more Riley patent skepticism

    • With an eye to the company's patent dispute with Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA), B. Riley has cut TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO) to Neutral.
    • TiVo shares are down 6.6% today.
    • Shares slid last week when Riley maintained a Buy rating but trimmed its price target on the same issue: uncertainty around the patent ruling.
    • Comcast has worked around the ITC ruling and that opens a door to "potentially working to avoid an ongoing license," says Riley's Eric Wold. And TiVo's pursuit of other patents would be a multi-year process.
    • He had cut the price target to $24 from $31 last week; now he's cutting to a Street low of $18, vs. today's price of $14.85.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM | 3 Comments
  • AEMD

    Aethlon Medical breaks out, shares up 38%

    • Nano cap Aethlon Medical (AEMD +37.5%) breaks out of a two-month base on more than a 6x surge in volume. No particular news accounts for the action. Many times it presages an equity offering although the company just completed one two months ago.
    • In October, the company raised ~$6M via the sale of ~5.5M units at $1.10 per unit.
    • At end of September, the company had $920K in cash while operations consumed ~$1M in each of the two most recent quarters. Assuming the same rate of cash use, it will need to raise additional capital in late Q1/early Q2, if not earlier.
    • Previously: Aethlon Medical prices equity offering; shares down 35% premarket (Oct. 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 4 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:55 pm

    • Gainers: CPAH +84%. DPW +24%. STRM +24%. FNSR +21%. ELTK +19%.
    • Losers: HMNY -34%. BVSN -12%. OPNT -11%. NETE -11%. RDFN -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 2 Comments
  • FFIV

    Another exec departing F5 as CFO sets retirement

    • F5 Networks (FFIV -2.9%) says its chief financial officer informed the company he's retiring in F5's fiscal third quarter.
    • That quarter ends June 30, 2018; Andrew Reinland will stay in the role until then.
    • That follows the retirement last month of its chief operating officer Edward Eames, and news early this month of the resignation of chief marketing officer Benjamin Gibson to pursue another opportunity.
    • And CEO Francois Locoh-Donou joined in April after the retirement of John McAdam.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • GRUB

    GrubHub in nationwide deal with Cheesecake Factory

    • GrubHub (GRUB +1.8%) has expanded its deal with The Cheesecake Factory nationwide.
    • The food-ordering and delivery service will offer Cheesecake Factory items in 18 states.
    • That means home delivery in Alabama, Arizona, California, Connecticut, Florida, Kentucky, Michigan, Nebraska, New Jersey, New Mexico, New York, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, Tennessee, Utah, Virginia, and Wisconsin.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM | 7 Comments
  • FNSR

    Finisar clarifies Apple investment, Apple COO discusses $1B fund's limits

    • Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR) releases a statement clarifying the $390M Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) investment announced this morning.
    • ”Apple has not made a debt or equity investment in Finisar. The amount referred to by Apple represents anticipated future business between the companies over a period of time.”
    • The Finisar funding was the second project from Apple’s $1B Advanced Manufacturing Fund, which previously invested $200M in Corning.
    • Apple COO Jeff Williams tells CNBC that $1B isn’t the upper limit of the fund. Williams says the company isn’t “thinking in terms of a fund limit” but rather “where are the opportunities across the U.S. to help nurture companies that are making the advanced technology.”
    • Finisar shares are up 22%.
    • Previously: Apple invests $390M in Finisar (Dec. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 21 Comments

  • Treasurys hold gains after Fed, gold gains

    • Things out of the Fed this afternoon sound somewhat hawkish - the central bank hiking rates 25 basis points, holding fast to its expectations for three more moves in 2018, and a sizable increase in its estimate for GDP growth next year (alongside a decent drop in the expected unemployment rate).
    • Outgoing Chair Janet Yellen, however, was not able to keep the doves in line, with the Chicago Fed's Evans and the Minneapolis Fed's Kashkari both dissenting from today's vote to raise rates.
    • Next year, though, will see both of those doves rotating out of voting membership on the FOMC. Among those getting votes will be hawks at the San Francisco and Cleveland Feds.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield remains down about four basis points. TLT +0.6%, TBT -1.2%
    • Gold (NYSEARCA:GLD) has added a bit to gains, now up 0.8%, while the dollar (NYSEARCA:UUP) remains just modestly lower.
    • Janet Yellen's press conference begins at 2:30 ET.
    • Previously: Fed still sees three rate hikes next year (Dec. 13)
    • Previously: Fed hikes rates for third time this year (Dec. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 24 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: SVM +8%. AG +8%. EXK +7%. MUX +7%. NDRO-OLD +7%.
    • Losers: BRS -16%. REXX -11%. WLB -8%. NBLX -7%. TRCH -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 3 Comments
  • EADSY

    Airbus beats out Boeing for big Delta order - CNN

    • According to the report, Delta later today will announce a deal for about 100 Airbus (OTCPK:EADSY -0.1%) A321neo jets. Alongside will be a purchase of Pratt & Whitney (UTX +0.6%) engines.
    • Boeing (NYSE:BA) had hoped the order would be for its 737 Max 10s.
    • This would come one day after Canada officially scrapped plans for 18 new Super Hornets in favor of used fighters from Australia.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM | 81 Comments
  • ICPT

    Longs quietly moving into Intercept Pharma; shares up 9%

    • Intercept Pharmaceuticals (ICPT +8.9%) is approaching near-term resistance as investors move into the stock after September's plunge. Shares lost about half their value after the company reported patient deaths due to incorrect dosing of Ocaliva (obeticholic acid) in patients with primary biliary cholangitis (PBC).
    • Deutsche Bank upgraded the stock to Strong Buy this morning. According to Yahoo Finance, 10 of 20 analysts are bullish on the stock.
    • In October, the company reported positive results in a Phase 2 study of Ocaliva in primary sclerosing cholangitis, a potential new use for the product. The FDA approved it in May 2016 for PBC.
    • Previously: Intercept reports that Ocaliva-related deaths in certain PBC patients due to failure to follow recommended dosing regimen; shares ahead 5% premarket (Sept. 25)
    • Previously: Intercept's OCA shows treatment effect in mid-stage PSC study; shares ahead 3% after hours (Oct. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM | 7 Comments
  • MTN

    Vail Resorts rides Deutsche Bank upgrade higher

    • Vail Resorts (MTN +1.2%) tracks higher after Deutsche Bank initiates coverage on the resort operator with a Buy rating.
    • Deutsche Bank's price target of $265 on Vail reps +20% upside potential.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 7 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: CPAH +100%. ELTK +38%. DPW +29%. STRM +28%. FNSR +28%. VERU +21%. SMSI +19%. LTEA +20%. MFIN +18%. CLLS +14%.
    • Losers: HMNY -32%. NAT -25%. BRS -17%. RIOT -13%. LENS -13%. CIVI -11%. CHCI -10%. TIK -10%. BVSN -10%. ARCB -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 6 Comments
  • TEVA

    Teva down 6% ahead of details on restructuring plan

    • Teva Pharmaceutical Industries (TEVA -5.8%) slumps on average volume ahead of tomorrow's press release at 7:00 am ET detailing its restructuring plan. A conference call will follow an hour later.
    • According to an earlier report, the plan includes laying off 1/3 of its Israel-based workforce.
    • Previously: Teva restructuring plan coming Thursday (Dec. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 72 Comments
  • AYI

    Acuity Brands drops 6.5% on Baird Lighting Survey

    • Acuity Brands (NYSE:AYI) falls after a Baird analyst says lighting volume in Q1 looks flat on the year.
    • Analyst Timothy Wojs cites a survey that shows lighting volume slowing from the 3% gains last quarter and pricing that will remain challenging partly due to imports. 
    • Baird rates Acuity at Neutral with a $178 price target, down from $186. 
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
    • Acuity Brands shares are down 6.5%. 
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 3 Comments
  • CNHI

    Caterpillar's big run continues; Barclays positive, Goldman lifts PT

    • Initiating coverage on the U.S. machinery and construction sector, Barclays' Adam Seiden, says sales bases are low, political rhetoric high, and risk/reward skewed positive even after a big run this year.
    • His top pick is CNH Industrial (CNHI +2.1%), but he's also overweight Caterpillar (CAT +3.3%), Deere (DE +1.2%), Herc Holdings (HRI +2.2%), Jacobs Engineering (JEC +0.9%), Manitowoc (MTW +1.8%), Vulcan Material (VMC +0.9%), and Welbilt (WBT +0.6%). He's underweight Aecom (ACM -2.1%), and United Rentals (URI +0.7%).
    • Meanwhile, Bloomberg reports Goldman as having boosted its already Street-high earnings estimates for CAT.
    • CAT earlier today reported retail machine sales as up 26% in November vs. 19% in October and 13% in September.
    • The industrials' (XLI +0.7%) gain today is easily besting the S&P 500's 0.2% advance.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 8 Comments
  • CERN

    Cerner slips 1% on delay in VA EHR contract

    • Cerner (CERN -0.8%) eases on light volume in apparent response to the news that the Department of Veterans Affairs is holding up its electronic health record (EHR) contract due to questions about its interoperability with private sector partners.
    • VA Secretary David Shulkin acknowledges that the industry has struggled with the problem due to proprietary systems of vendors which may be unfair to big players (like Cerner). He says his agency has issued a request for information seeking data-sharing solutions in addition to ways to test interoperability.
    • Cerner's contract is valued at $10B or more.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • MBVX

    MabVax completes enrollment in first cohort in early-stage study of cancer candidate MVT-1075; shares up 4%

    • MabVax Therapeutics Holdings (OTCPK:MBVX +3.8%) completes enrollment in the first cohort of a 22-subject Phase 1 study assessing human antibody-based radioimmunotherapy candidate MVT-1075 in patients with metastatic CA19-9-positive pancreatic, colon and lung cancers.
    • The primary objective of the open-label study is safety and to determine the maximum tolerated dose. Secondary endpoints include efficacy measures.
    • Interim data should be available early next quarter.
    • MVT-1075 is a targeted cancer therapy that utilizes a fully human monoclonal antibody, HuMab-5B1, to deliver a cytotoxic payload, the radioisotope Lutetium-177, to cancer cells expressing the CA19-9 protein.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM | 1 Comment

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: LTEA +23%. FUV +13%. BETR +9%. WPRT +9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • STML

    Stemline's lead candidate successful in mid-stage study in rare bone marrow disorder; shares up 2%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Stemline Therapeutics (STML +2.3%) is up, albeit on light volume, on the heels of its announcement of a successful outcome in a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing lead candidate SL-401 in patients with a rare bone marrow disorder called blastic plasmacytoid dendritic cell neoplasm (DPDCN). The results were first reported in October.
    • Data from the pivotal Stage 3 portion of the trial showed an overall response rate (ORR) of 77% (n=10/13) and a 54% (n=7/13) complete response rate.
    • The company says it is preparing a U.S. marketing application.
    • Breakthrough Therapy- and Orphan Drug-tagged SL-401 is a recombinant fusion protein composed of certain domains of the diptheria toxin fused to interleukin 3 (IL3). It is called a targeted therapy because the IL3 seeks out IL3 receptors on cancer stem cells (CSCs), the malignant "seeds" of tumors, and tumor bulk of blood cancers. Binding to the receptors delivers the cytotoxin directly to the cancer cells.
    • Previously: Stemline's SL-401 successful in mid-stage BPDCN study; shares ahead 8% premarket (Oct. 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • INVVY

    FDA accepts Indivior's marketing application for once-monthly treatment for schizophrenia; licensor DURECT up 1%

    • The FDA accepts for review Indivior PLC's (OTCPK:INVVY) New Drug Application (NDA) seeking approval for RBP-7000 (risperidone), a once-monthly injection for the treatment of schizophrenia. The agency's action date is July 28, 2018.
    • Indivior acquired the U.S. rights from DURECT (DRRX +0.8%) in September 2017. Under the terms of the agreement, DURECT received $12.5M upfront and is eligible for a $5M regulatory milestone and quarterly earn-out payments based on a single-digit percentage of sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • TGT

    Target strikes huge same-day grocery delivery deal

    • Target (TGT +1.5%) signs a deal to acquire same-day grocery delivery specialist Shipt for $550M.
    • The retailer says it will leverage its network of stores and Shipt's proprietary technology platform and community of shoppers to quickly add same-day delivery.
    • The acquisition is expected to "significantly accelerate" Target's digital fulfillment efforts, including bringing same-day delivery services to customers at approximately half of Target stores by early 2018.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 51 Comments
  • CMTL

    Comtech +5.6% on order news

    • Comtech Telecommunications (NASDAQ:CMTL) received an order for over $9.4M for solid-state power amplifiers (SSPAs) for in-flight connectivity applications.
    • The order occurred in Q2 and will support Comtech Xicom Technology’s continued production of the product until late 2018.
    • Comtech shares are up 5.6%.   
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • CRCW

    Bitcoin mania as seen in a stock

    • via Charley Grant at the WSJ
    • "If I can quote Elon Musk," Crypto Co. (OTC:CRCW) CEO Michael Poutre tells the WSJ, "we are working very hard to grow into our valuation."
    • Indeed. Prior to a massive tumble yesterday amid a sale of 1.15M shares, CRCW was up several thousand percent since September and had a $12B valuation.
    • And what of the current valuation of $4B? Investors get a company that says it develops proprietary technology, consults on blockchain and crypto assets, has $2.6 of cash, and $900K worth of cryptocurrency (though this could be well higher after the recent run). Total Q3 revenues were $488K - nearly all of that coming from realized trading profits.
    • The OTC Markets Group last week designated CRCW as a "caveat emptor" security.
    • Shares have yet to trade today.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 19 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: VERU +16%. CLLS +15%. ENTA +13%. MNOV +8%. CAPR +8%.
    • Losers: LENS -13%. RIOT -12%. CIVI -10%. EYES -9%. GHDX -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • LXRX

    Sanofi's planned marketing application for diabetes med propels licensor Lexicon Pharmaceuticals, up 4%

    • Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (LXRX +4.3%) perks up, albeit on light volume, in response to Sanofi's announcement that it plans on filing a U.S. marketing application for sotagliflozin in type 1 diabetes (T1D) in 2018.
    • Sanofi acquired exclusive global rights (except Japan) to the dual SGLT1 and SGLT2 inhibitor under a November 2015 agreement with Lexicon. Under the terms of the deal, Lexicon has co-promotion rights in the U.S. for T1D.
    • Previously: Sanofi expects to file nine regulatory submissions over next 18 months (Dec. 13)
    • Previously: Sanofi and Lexicon Pharma sign $1.7B deal to co-develop new oral diabetes pill; Lexicon up 23% premarket (Nov. 6, 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • RPXC

    RPX up 5.6% after takeover offer report

    • IAM sources say RPX (NASDAQ:RPXC) received a takeover offer from a private consortium for $16.25 per share.  
    • The offer would value RPX at about $800M.
    • RPX went public in 2011 with a $19 per share IPO price. Co-founder and CEO John Amster left the company in February after urging the board to go private. 
    • RPX shares are up 5.6% to $13.50.  
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • ARCB

    ArcBest hit by Stifel downgrade

    • ArcBest (NASDAQ:ARCB) falls sharply after Stifel Nicolaus issues a harsh assessment on the freight/logistics stock due to concerns on the upcoming Teamsters negotiations.
    • The investment firm downgrades ArcBest to a Sell rating and sets a price target of $32.
    • Shares of ArcBest are down 11.28% to $34.20, and traded as low as $29.40 earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 2 Comments
  • NAT

    Nordic American Tankers sinks after equity offering

    • Nordic American Tankers (NAT -26.4%) falls sharply after the company prices the equity offering as part of its recapitalization program.
    • The company says that due to strong demand for shares the transaction has been upsized to $110M.
    • Nordic agreed to sell 40M shares at a public offering price of $2.75 per share.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM | 34 Comments
  • AMD

    Baidu will use AMD EPYC in global data centers

    • AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) and Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU) announce the availability of the AMD EPYC processor for Baidu customers seeking AI, big data, or cloud computing services.
    • Baidu plans to expand use of EPYC across its global data centers starting in Q1.
    • AMD shares are up 1.9%. 
    • Baidu shares are up 1%.  
    • Previously: AMD confirms working with Qualcomm on Always Connected PCs (Dec. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 88 Comments

  • EIA Petroleum Inventories

    • EIA Petroleum Inventories: Crude -5.1M barrels vs. -3.8M consensus, -5.6M last week.
    • Gasoline +5.7M barrels vs. +2.5M consensus, +6.8M last week.
    • Distillates -1.4M barrels vs. +1.0M consensus, +1.7M last week.
    • Futures +0.23% to $57.27.
    • ETFs:USO, OIL, UCO, SCO, BNO, DTO, DBO, USL, DNO, SZO, OLO, OLEM
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 79 Comments
  • IPG

    Interpublic lower by more than 2% after Jefferies downgrade

    • After a number of years of trimming fat, there's not a lot of room for additional margin expansion next year, says analyst John Janedis, downgrading Interpublic Group (IPG -2.7%) to Hold from Buy. The price target is cut to $20 from $24 (shares currently at $19.93).
    • Alongside, Janedis and team trim their price target on Omnicom (OMC -1.2%) to $72 from $82 (currently $73.68), expecting below-trend organic growth in North America next year thanks to increased competition, and the shift of ad dollars to in-house and digital platforms.
    • Source: Bloomberg's Jeremy Cooke

  • CAPR

    Capricor announces new U.S. patent covering CAP-2003; shares ahead 28% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap Capricor Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CAPR) jumps 28% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement that the USPTO has issued Patent No. 9,828,603, a composition of matter patent covering pipeline candidate CAP-2003, in development for the treatment of fibrotic diseases and inflammation.
    • CAP-2003 is a regenerative medicine therapy consisting of exosomes isolated from the company's cardiosphere-derived cells. Exosomes, nano-sized membrane-enclosed vesicles secreted by cells that contain proteins, RNAs and microDNAs, act as messengers to regulate cellular processes.
    • The patent was assigned to Cedars-Sinai Medical Center which granted Capricor exclusive global rights to the technology.

  • Yields dip on slow CPI print

    • Headline CPI matched expectations, rising 0.4% in November alongside a sizable jump in gasoline prices.
    • Core inflation, however, gained just 0.1% vs. 0.2% expected. On a year-over-year basis, core CPI is now running at 1.7% vs. 1.8% a month earlier.
    • While the news is likely to give fuel to those at the Fed wishing to pause rate hikes until inflation picks up, it's probably not going to halt what almost all expect to be another boost in short-term rates at the close of today's FOMC meeting.
    • The 10-year yield has dropped five basis points since the CPI number hit, now down 3.5 bps on the session to 2.373%. TLT +0.4%, TBT -0.8%
    • ETFs: TLT, TBT, TMV, TBF, EDV, TMF, TTT, ZROZ, VGLT, TLH, UBT, TLO, DLBS, VUSTX, TYBS, DLBL

  • PFE

    Servier and Pfizer's CAR-T candidate shows positive effect in two early-stage leukemia studies; licensor Cellectis up 13% premarket

    • Preliminary results from two Phase 1 clinical trials assessing Servier and Pfizer's (NYSE:PFE) CAR-T candidate, UCART19, in leukemia patients showed a treatment effect. The data were presented at ASH in Atlanta.
    • The first study, CALM, is evaluating UCART19 in adult patients with relapsed/refractory CD-19-positive B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (B-ALL). Five of seven (71%) subjects achieved molecular remission at day 28 after treatment. Molecular remission is defined as negative minimal residual disease (MRD) (the number of residual leukemic cells remaining after treatment). The dose of UCART19 used in the first cohort was about 1/10 of that used in most autologous CAR-T studies.
    • On the safety front, one mild case of acute graft-versus-host disease (GvHD) was observed. No severe neurotoxicity was observed. There was one death due to cytokine release syndrome (CRS) and neutropenic (abnormally low level of neutrophils) sepsis. All other cases of CRS were mild and manageable.
    • The second study, PALL, is assessing UCART19 in pediatric patients with high-risk relapsed/refractory B-ALL. All five children treated achieved MRD negativity enabling them to proceed to allogeneic stem cell transplant.
    • Only one mild case of GvHD was observed. No neurotoxicity occurred and CRSs were mostly mild and all were manageable.
    • Servier and Pfizer are co-developing UCART19. Servier obtained exclusive global rights from Cellectis (NASDAQ:CLLS) in November 2015.
    • CLLS is up 13% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM | 16 Comments
